, "Lasse Koskela" <lasse.koskela@...> wrote:
>
> On 10/23/06, Magnus <t7030=
93@...> wrote:
> >  so I have to write:
> >  import X;
> >
> >  in the top =
of the TestX.java ?
> 
> It depends. In what package is your "X" class defi=
ned? If it's the
> default package, then no import statement is needed. If =
X is defined
> in, say, package "com.acme" then you need to "import com.acm=
e.X;".
> 
> There's probably some Java tutorial out there in the internet t=
hat
> tells you more about the magic of import statements.
> 
> Lasse
>
